column4: I'm trying to install updates via Update Manager, but it says that some of the packages are untrusted, and that causes the update to fail. Apparently 'compiz' is untrusted... How do I get past this?
uncheck compiz and uncheck the source where you update compiz from, unless it's ubuntu's original source
I'm not sure what source it's getting it from. How do I find out?
open up synaptic or the update manager and go to settings / sources
there's no sources tab
there's settings, right?
Yes, it opens up the "Software Sources" window with tabs {Ubuntu Software, Other Software, Updates, Authentication, Statistics}
on the updates screen
take the second tab
Other software
done
see if you got a source there for compiz
if you don't now, run 'sudo apt-get update' in your terminal and check which source is giving you trouble
None of them seem to be giving me trouble. None of the ones listed seems to be specifically for compiz. There's Independant, pidgin-dev, pidgen-dev, and Canonical PArtners
do you get an error if you run apt-get update, and what error?
none. It hits and igns a bunch of stuff. Ign all the translation stuff.
i'm not sure then, update without updating compiz and check back later; maybe someone can tell you more
the problem isn't just compiz. It's almost all of them are reporting that most of the stuff is untrusted
hang on... it seems to be doing something now
then you probably need to reimport the keys for the ubuntu servers
or a temporary error
it seems to have fixed itself. Temporary error.
